reg_info.act_under: Places to Grow Act, 2005   Loi de 2005 sur les zones de croissance

content.content: 1. In this Regulation, “geographic area” means a geographic area that is prescribed for the purposes of the Territorial Division Act, 2002.  O. Reg. 416/05, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. In this Regulation,

“geographic area” means a geographic area that is prescribed for the purposes of the Territorial Division Act, 2002.  O. Reg. 416/05, s. 1.

content.section: Greater Golden Horseshoe growth plan area
content.content: 2. The area of land comprised of the following geographic areas is designated as the Greater Golden Horseshoe growth plan area: 1. Brant. 2. Dufferin. 3. Durham. 4. Haldimand. 5. Halton. 6. Hamilton. 7. Kawartha Lakes. 8. Niagara. 9. Northumberland. 10. Peel. 11. Peterborough. 12. Simcoe. 13. Toronto. 14. Waterloo. 15. Wellington. 16. York.  O. Reg. 416/05, s. 2.
content.raw_html:
2. The area of land comprised of the following geographic areas is designated as the Greater Golden Horseshoe growth plan area:

1. Brant.

2. Dufferin.

3. Durham.

4. Haldimand.

5. Halton.

6. Hamilton.

7. Kawartha Lakes.

8. Niagara.

9. Northumberland.

10. Peel.

11. Peterborough.

12. Simcoe.

13. Toronto.

14. Waterloo.

15. Wellington.

16. York.  O. Reg. 416/05, s. 2.

content.content: 3. The area of land comprised of the following geographic areas is designated as the Northern Ontario growth plan area: 1. Algoma. 2. Cochrane. 3. Kenora. 4. Manitoulin. 5. Nipissing. 6. Parry Sound. 7. Rainy River. 8. Sudbury. 9. Thunder Bay. 10. Timiskaming.  O. Reg. 385/09, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
3. The area of land comprised of the following geographic areas is designated as the Northern Ontario growth plan area:

1. Algoma.

2. Cochrane.

3. Kenora.

4. Manitoulin.

5. Nipissing.

6. Parry Sound.

7. Rainy River.

9. Thunder Bay.

10. Timiskaming.  O. Reg. 385/09, s. 1.
